TopicTitle: How long have you been playing kerbal space program for?

Articles.Content: I'm wondering when the most people joined KSP!
I started two years ago with I think version .11 (the one just before mun). Downloaded from a Colombian hotel room which I promptly didn't leave for two days
Pretty sure it was just before the 0.20 update.

I started playing when Quill18 on youtube did a "lets Try" of it a few years ago. It was before the mun, timewarp, and orbital maps lol so not much to it. I lost track of it after mun was released for a few months then bought it the day .15 came out
.16, a few weeks before .17 was released.
I started around 0.8 or 0.9, back when there were only about 10 parts and no timewarp or map.

Specifically since 0.22 - it came up on Steam, and as an old Orbiter Spaceflight Simulator player, I knew I had to have it even in it's current pre-release state. The demo clinched it, though, gotta say. I mean really - use spare parts to build working rockets - trial and error (by fire)?! Where do I sign up!!! I did wait until 0.23 to start my Youtube channel, though.

I started with 0.11, as my forum join date attests to nicely. It was good timing, seeing as 0.12 came out not too long after and gave me a goal to aim for besides getting into orbit (and thus made sure I kept paying attention to the game; I might have gotten tired of it pretty fast if I'd started with 0.8 or something and had to wait that long to get somewhere to go besides Kerbin orbit!).
0.17, shortly before the 0.18 update came out... So I've been playing almost one year now.

Since before the first time this question was asked.

(More seriously, 0.8.4)
Started playing just before .18, but got into it after .18 dropped and spaceplanes became a reality.

17.0

So over a year. So many hours spent flying little green men to other worlds.
i started with .13 lost intrest, then came back and havent seen light of day in a while
Bought the game in January, so some time around 0.18.

Ever since 0.13.2 and the release of the first 0.14 experimental.

So about... a year and 9 months.
I got it in .20
I found the game when the game was in 0.14, but I brought it in 0.15. So I chose that option
0.17 was my start. I was a forum lurker for a while.
About 0.13, the good old days
0.18.2, it's very nearly been a whole year of KSP. Wow.
I started in 0.19. Then I got hooked and here I am, as excited as the average veteran for another update.
